keyword: how many calories in deviled egg
title: How Many Calories in a Deviled Egg?
meta_description: Learn how many calories in deviled egg with a full nutrition breakdown, including protein, fat, carbs, and simple recipe tweaks for healthier options.
h1: How Many Calories in a Deviled Egg?
assumptions: Standard recipe: 1 large hard-boiled egg (halved), mixed with 1 tsp mayonnaise, mustard, paprika; per half-egg serving, no added relish or bacon.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, ingredient brands, egg size, and preparation; homemade versions differ from store-bought. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One deviled egg contains about 75 kcal and 3 g protein.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaged foods.

tweaks.label: Use low-fat mayonnaise instead of full-fat
Add 1 tsp pickle relish per egg
Top with crumbled bacon (1/2 slice per egg)

faqs.q: How many calories in one deviled egg?
faqs.a: Approximately 75 kcal for a standard deviled egg.

faqs.q: What is the protein content in a deviled egg?
faqs.a: About 3 g protein per deviled egg, mostly from the egg white and yolk.
Yes, with only 0.5 g carbs per deviled egg and no fiber.

faqs.q: How does mayo affect calories in deviled eggs?
faqs.a: Mayo adds most of the fat and calories; swapping for Greek yogurt reduces it by ~15 kcal per egg.

faqs.q: What about cholesterol in deviled eggs?
faqs.a: One deviled egg has ~95 mg cholesterol, primarily from the yolk.
